Roasting chicken drumsticks in a convection oven isn't any more difficult than cooking them in a traditional oven, though you will need to use a lower temperature and expect a shorter cooking time. A convection oven is a handy cooking tool to have because it cooks food more quickly than a conventional oven and yields more golden brown and juicy meat, according to the Fine Cooking website.

You should cook chicken legs in an convection oven for between 20 and 30 minutes depending on the temperature. The air movement of convection ovens greatly reduces cooking times when compared to traditional ovens.

I take the chicken out of the refrigerator about an hour before cooking, set the oven at 325 and roast until a thermometer in the breast reads between 160-165. When roasting a chicken in a non-convection oven, it will cook faster and more evenly on a roasting rack than sitting low in a pan, because the part of the bird sitting low in the pan gets surrounded by a sort of 'cushion' of cooler air.
